77 years ago today, six U.S. Marines raised the American flag at the peak of Mount Suribachi during the Battle of Iwo Jima.

This iconic image serves as a reminder that the price of America's liberty is paid for by the heroes who secure it. https://t.co/fHxOVXRpZf

As an independent nation, Ukraine’s rights to maintain its national sovereignty, defend its territorial integrity, and manage its associations within the global order are absolute. 

Now is the time for the Free World to rise up in defense of liberty.

My full statement ⤵️ https://t.co/57xLV6uzJM

By strengthening Ukraine’s position, demonstrating a unified global coalition, and forcing Putin to grasp the devastating consequences Russia will suffer – the world may avert the full breakout of war the likes of which it has not seen in nearly a century.
Now is the time for the Free World to rise up in defense of liberty.

The Free World has a responsibility to uphold the tenants of the Budapest Memorandum and Minsk Agreement, and to deter further Russian invasion of Ukraine through harsh and decisive political, economic, and defensive measures.
Ukraine’s security and its ability to exercise self-determination cannot be bargained away by Russian fiat – they must be guaranteed.

Putin, however, is testing the West’s commitments to the international rule of law and the mutual defense compacts that have preserved peace on the European continent throughout the post-World War II era.
As an independent nation, Ukraine’s rights to maintain its national sovereignty, defend its territorial integrity, and manage its associations within the global order are absolute.

Ukraine is not a threat to Russia, but Ukraine’s independence and democracy jeopardizes Putin’s stranglehold on power, and imperils his standing among the Russian people. Driven by his quest for self-preservation, Putin has fraudulently built the case for war.
This region of the world should be free and prosperous, not denied hope and opportunity by a corrupt and merciless tyrant.

Putin is a murderous dictator whose objective is rigid control of society. He accomplishes his barbaric schemes by suppressing human rights, eliminating independent media, assassinating political opponents, and limiting economic opportunity.

Now, at Vladimir Putin’s direction, Russia has illegally declared that sovereign Ukrainian territory is independent, and ordered troops to the region. This hostility is reminiscent of the tragic carnage unleashed by Putin over the years in Georgia, Moldova, and Armenia.

Through its rapid escalation of conflict, breach of cease-fire agreements, and hostile and irresponsible rhetoric, Russia has flagrantly rejected the norms of legal and civil behavior to which respectable nation states have long adhered.

The ongoing journey to form a more perfect Union requires an understanding and acknowledgement of the past which lies behind us. As we lift up and embrace the history of Black Americans, we also celebrate the next chapter – and the ones to follow – that are already being written.

To properly recognize this vast legacy, however, requires an extension beyond the bounds of one single month. Black history is not separate from American history – it is foundational to American history.
Throughout February, we honor the history of Black Americans in writing the long and unfinished work that is the American story.

On this and all days, let us seek to better the condition of all humankind. Let us further dedicate ourselves to continuing the valiant mission of Dr. King.

His call for brotherhood reverberates across generations. Let America hear his voice. Let our society respect its own pluralism which serves as the very bedrock of our nation. America is precious among nations – let us treat her and one another that way.

The Reverend Dr. King’s life is a living legacy. His inspired call to justice intersects directly with America’s own struggle to attain its highest ideals for all people. America remains an unfinished work.
Today’s commemoration of his life and work provides an opportunity for remembrance, reflection, and rededication. Who are we as a people and a nation?

National holidays are established in memory of the very few whose vision and raw courage define America’s soul and moral character.

On Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, we honor a giant among men who envisioned an America that truly lived up to the promises our founders decreed.

I fought to pass the Jobs & Infrastructure bill in Congress, and now Ohio will receive more than $480 million over the next 5 years to rebuild crumbling bridges.

Investing in infrastructure = good-paying jobs + stronger communities. https://t.co/SX8F56eapr

Thanks to the Jobs & Infrastructure bill I helped pass, we now have more than $17 billion to invest in strengthening and improving America's port infrastructure - and I will fight alongside our local partners for our region to receive its fair share.

Great Lakes ports are critical to the distribution of industrial and agricultural goods across the country and around the globe.

Our ports play a central role in fueling the economy and supporting good-paying Middle Class jobs for workers and families. https://t.co/TTY4EJzElj
I am proud to support the Guard and Reserve G.I. Bill Parity Act to ensure these distinguished patriots receive the education benefits they most certainly deserve.

From protecting the homeland and supporting the mission of troops abroad, to responding to natural disasters and the Covid-19 pandemic – National Guard members and Military Reservists have served America honorably at a time when they were needed most.
Over the last several years, our National Guard members and Military Reservists have increasingly been called upon to support critical missions across Ohio and throughout the nation.

Today, House Democrats passed the G.I. Bill Parity Act, which will ensure National Guard members and Military Reservists have equal access to education benefits as active duty servicemembers. https://t.co/qEhorU4lDT

While the events of that day were appalling, they have only deepened my resolve to help heal the nation, bridge the divide, and safeguard our democracy. For on the success of this endeavor, I believe the fate of present and future generations certainly depends.
Political violence, on the other hand, is not a legitimate mechanism to enact change. It is an act of cowardice, and a stain against our republic.
In America, we have the awesome ability to debate, disagree, compromise, and legislate for the common good – and we can do so through the ballot box.

Some officers ultimately lost their lives, while many more left with wounds that they still bear to this day. All courageously upheld their oaths in service to this nation, and in service to democracy.
On January 6th, 2021, I watched as U.S. Capitol Police officers defended the Capitol complex, along with the lives of thousands of people.
One year ago today, the hallowed grounds of the United States Capitol, and the very system of governance that has sustained our country for more than two centuries, came under attack.

As always, if there is ever anything with which our office can be helpful in the year ahead, we are ready and able to assist however we can.

Onward!
I will continue the fight to help create good-paying jobs, rebuild our infrastructure, lower the cost of healthcare, and support our children, families, and seniors.
In 2022, I will continue to work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to ensure that our communities not only recover, but are strengthened for the days ahead.
Thank you to the healthcare heroes, first responders, grocery and food workers, small business owners, teachers, and so many more hardworking men and women who keep us moving.

Last year was one of enormous change, particularly with the pandemic touching nearly every facet of our daily lives.

Through it all, I feel a deep sense of gratitude for those who continued to provide essential services that we all rely upon.
As we begin this New Year, we reflect on where we have been, and look ahead at the possibilities that await us.

Edna Brown was a trailblazer who dedicated her life to bettering the lives of others. Her unrelenting compassion and hard work left its mark on Toledo. She was a one of a kind woman, friend, and leader whose loss weighs heavily, and whose legacy will live on through the ages. https://t.co/uJGH6fKMWu

Our best weapons in this fight are the vaccines that medical science has gifted us. In order to emerge from this pandemic, we all must do our part and get vaccinated – and boosted – as quickly as possible.
With the Omicron variant surging, the health and safety of our loved ones, friends, and frontline healthcare heroes depends on the actions that each one of us takes right now.

No one has been spared by the devastation unleashed by Covid-19, and we all yearn for the dawn of a new day. But as we grapple with the heart-wrenching loss of nearly 30,000 of our neighbors across Ohio, now is not the time to let our guard down.
The new steps @POTUS announced today to combat the spread of this deadly virus - from free at-home testing, to expanded hospital support - will save lives, and protect our communities.

On this solemn day, we honor the memory of those we lost, lift up in prayer the loved ones left behind, and express our deep gratitude to those heroes and heroines – known and unknown – whose service to country before self has ensured the blessings of abiding Liberty in our land.
From firefighters, police officers, nurses, and doctors – to the patriotic men and women who joined our armed forces to bring justice to the perpetrators.
In the hours, days, and weeks that followed, countless Americans of all stripes and creeds answered the call to serve our nation in one of her darkest hours…

The lives of nearly 3,000 of our fellow Americans were brutally cut short, leaving husbands and wives, parents and children, and friends and neighbors to bear an unimaginable loss, and mourn a future that would never come to pass.
Twenty years after the enemies of democracy and freedom unleashed terror on our homeland, the horror we feel today is as clear and traumatizing as it was that Tuesday morning.

How does your family qualify for #ChildTaxCredit payments?

If you filed 2019 or 2020 taxes, or signed up to receive a stimulus payment, you will get these monthly payments automatically via direct deposit or a check in the mail - you do not need to sign up or take any action.

These #ChildTaxCredit payments will put money in the bank accounts of hard-working folks throughout northern Ohio, improving the lives of nearly 150,000 children in Ohio’s 9th Congressional District.
